meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of dirt or filth.
meanings.sent1: The old rug was so cruddy that it needed a good wash.
meanings.sent2: The cruddy streets made it hard to keep my shoes clean.
meanings.sent3: I tried to clean the cruddy windows, but they just got dirtier!
meanings.sent4: Her cruddy hands were a testament to a hard day's work.
meanings.sent5: The cruddy mud on the floor left footprints everywhere.

meanings.definition: Of poor quality or in a bad condition.
meanings.sent1: The cruddy old car barely made it up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The cruddy paint job on the house needed a fresh coat.
meanings.sent3: His cruddy jokes always made us laugh, even if they were bad.
meanings.sent4: The cruddy situation at work left everyone feeling down.
meanings.sent5: The cruddy sandwich tasted worse than it looked.
